title: Patient_2_J4
treatment_protocol: Blood samples were first diluted (1:2) with phosphate-buffered saline, layered over Ficoll-Paque (Biochrom, Germany) and centrifuged. Neutrophils were then aspirated and collected; after a washing step and red blood cell lysis (Versalyse, Beckman Coulter), viability and purity were determined by flow cytometry using LDS 751 (Life Technologies, Carlsbad, CA). Human neutrophil Enrichment Kit (Stem Cell, Canada) was used to purify neutrophils following the manufacturerâ€™s recommendations. 5.107 cells/well (dilution in recommended buffer: PBS + 2% Fetal Bovine Serum or 0.5% BSA+ 1mM EDTA) were plated into a 96-untreated U-bottom plate (Corning, NY) and 50Âµl/ml of EasySepâ„¢ Human Enrichment Cocktail were added for 10 min. Incubation with 100Âµl/ml of EasySepâ„¢ D Magnetic Particles for 5 min preceded the action held by the EasyPlateâ„¢ magnet when placing the plate onto the magnet for 10 min. The supernatant contained the enriched neutrophils. Granulocytes were suspended in Qiagen RLT Buffer (Qiagen, the Netherlands) containing 1% B-mercaptoethanol and stored at -80Â°C until RNA isolation.
extract_protocol: RNA was isolated using Qiagen RNAeasy Plus Mini RNA isolation kit according to the manufacturerâ€™s protocol. The integrity and quality of the total RNA was assessed on an Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Germany) by means of the RNA 6000 Nano assay (Agilent). cDNA was synthesized from 50 ng total RNA using the WT-Ovationâ„¢ System (NuGEN, San Carlos, CA).
label: biotin
label_protocol: Fragmented cDNA was end-labeled with a biotin-conjugated nucleotide analog (DLR-1a; Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA) by using terminal transferase (Roche Diagnostics, Germany).
hybridization_protocol: Fragmented and labeled cDNA was hybridized for 18 h at 50Â°C. Hybridization was performed using GeneChipÂ® Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 arrays (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: The microarrays were read with the GeneChip Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix).
data_processing: Normalization processing and quality controls were performed using R/Bioconductor (R version 3.0.0 (2013-04-03)) (R Development Core Team â€“ 2009). We performed quality controls at both probe and probeset levels). Raw expression profiles were normalized using the GC-RMA algorithm (R/Bioconductor). To reduce the number of probeset, we applied a filtering process based on the MAS5.0 p-values.

scan_protocol: The microarrays were read with the GeneChip Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix).
data_processing: Normalization processing and quality controls were performed using R/Bioconductor (R version 3.0.0 (2013-04-03)) (R Development Core Team â€“ 2009). We performed quality controls at both probe and probeset levels). Raw expression profiles were normalized using the GC-RMA algorithm (R/Bioconductor). To reduce the number of probeset, we applied a filtering process based on the MAS5.0 p-values.

title: Patient_19_J6
treatment_protocol: Blood samples were first diluted (1:2) with phosphate-buffered saline, layered over Ficoll-Paque (Biochrom, Germany) and centrifuged. Neutrophils were then aspirated and collected; after a washing step and red blood cell lysis (Versalyse, Beckman Coulter), viability and purity were determined by flow cytometry using LDS 751 (Life Technologies, Carlsbad, CA). Human neutrophil Enrichment Kit (Stem Cell, Canada) was used to purify neutrophils following the manufacturerâ€™s recommendations. 5.107 cells/well (dilution in recommended buffer: PBS + 2% Fetal Bovine Serum or 0.5% BSA+ 1mM EDTA) were plated into a 96-untreated U-bottom plate (Corning, NY) and 50Âµl/ml of EasySepâ„¢ Human Enrichment Cocktail were added for 10 min. Incubation with 100Âµl/ml of EasySepâ„¢ D Magnetic Particles for 5 min preceded the action held by the EasyPlateâ„¢ magnet when placing the plate onto the magnet for 10 min. The supernatant contained the enriched neutrophils. Granulocytes were suspended in Qiagen RLT Buffer (Qiagen, the Netherlands) containing 1% B-mercaptoethanol and stored at -80Â°C until RNA isolation.
extract_protocol: RNA was isolated using Qiagen RNAeasy Plus Mini RNA isolation kit according to the manufacturerâ€™s protocol. The integrity and quality of the total RNA was assessed on an Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Germany) by means of the RNA 6000 Nano assay (Agilent). cDNA was synthesized from 50 ng total RNA using the WT-Ovationâ„¢ System (NuGEN, San Carlos, CA).
